articles.headline: U.S. Population Over Last Decade Grew at Slowest Rate Since 1930s
articles.snippet: With immigration leveling off and a declining birthrate, the United States may be entering an era of substantially lower population growth, demographers said.
articles.abstract: With immigration leveling off and a declining birthrate, the United States may be entering an era of substantially lower population growth, demographers said.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over the past decade, the United States population grew at the second slowest rate since the government started counting in 1790, the Census Bureau reported on Monday, a remarkable slackening that was driven by a slowdown in immigration and a declining birthrate.
articles.byline: By Sabrina Tavernise and Robert Gebeloff

articles.headline: Still Getting Your Head Around Digital Currency? So Are Central Bankers.
articles.snippet: If you are trying to grasp Bitcoin and understand what China’s digital yuan means, America’s Federal Reserve is right there with you.
articles.abstract: If you are trying to grasp Bitcoin and understand what China’s digital yuan means, America’s Federal Reserve is right there with you.
articles.lead_paragraph: America’s Federal Reserve says it is in no rush to issue a digital currency, but it is coming under intense and increasing pressure to research and understand the design and potential of digital money.

articles.headline: A Surprise Ending for the Oscars’ Inclusive Night
articles.snippet: Six years after #OscarsSoWhite, a diverse roster of artists won awards, though Anthony Hopkins’s win over Chadwick Boseman as best actor surprised many.
articles.abstract: Six years after #OscarsSoWhite, a diverse roster of artists won awards, though Anthony Hopkins’s win over Chadwick Boseman as best actor surprised many.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — In a break with tradition, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences decided to end its Oscars ceremony on Sunday with the prize for best actor instead of the one for best picture.
articles.byline: By Nicole Sperling and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Jeff Bezos’ Rocket Company Challenges NASA Over SpaceX Moon Lander Deal
articles.snippet: The space agency picked Elon Musk’s company over two other bidders to take its astronauts back to the lunar surface.
articles.abstract: The space agency picked Elon Musk’s company over two other bidders to take its astronauts back to the lunar surface.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jeff Bezos and Elon Musk, two of the richest men in the world, both with dreams of leading humanity out into the solar system, are fighting over the moon.

articles.headline: As Virus Rages Abroad, Biden Promises to Ship Millions of Vaccine Doses
articles.snippet: President Biden will send up to 60 million doses of AstraZeneca’s vaccine to countries pleading for help, but some see a medicine dropper for “a four-alarm fire.”
articles.abstract: President Biden will send up to 60 million doses of AstraZeneca’s vaccine to countries pleading for help, but some see a medicine dropper for “a four-alarm fire.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden, under intense pressure to do more to address the surging pandemic abroad, including a humanitarian crisis in India, intends to make up to 60 million doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine available to other countries, so long as federal regulators deem the doses safe, officials said Monday.

articles.headline: How Identity Thieves Took My Wife for a Ride
articles.snippet: Auto insurers try to make it easy to sign up for a policy. Those efforts have given an opening to scammers.
articles.abstract: Auto insurers try to make it easy to sign up for a policy. Those efforts have given an opening to scammers.
articles.lead_paragraph: The first sign of trouble was the arrival of envelopes from the New York State Department of Labor, all about my wife’s previous earnings and recent unemployment filing. The second was the cheery “Welcome to Progressive” package, telling her how great it was to have her with the company now that she had bought her new auto insurance policy.

articles.headline: Biden Seeks $80 Billion to Beef Up I.R.S. Audits of High-Earners
articles.snippet: The president’s “American Families Plan,” which he will detail this week, will be offset in part by a tax enforcement effort that administration officials believe will raise $700 billion over a decade.
articles.abstract: The president’s “American Families Plan,” which he will detail this week, will be offset in part by a tax enforcement effort that administration officials believe will raise $700 billion over a decade.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden, looking to pay for his ambitious economic agenda and shift more of the nation’s tax burden to the wealthy, will propose giving the Internal Revenue Service an extra $80 billion and more authority over the next 10 years to help crack down on tax evasion by high-earners and large corporations.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: After Failures to Curb Sexual Assault, a Move Toward a Major Shift in Military Law
articles.snippet: Senator Kirsten Gillibrand has fought for years to remove commanders from deciding assault cases. Now, more colleagues and a Pentagon panel agree.
articles.abstract: Senator Kirsten Gillibrand has fought for years to remove commanders from deciding assault cases. Now, more colleagues and a Pentagon panel agree.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After decades of failing to curb sexual assault in the armed forces, lawmakers and Pentagon leaders are poised to make major changes in military laws that many experts have long argued stand in the way of justice.

articles.headline: College Accounts at Birth: State Efforts Raise New Hopes
articles.snippet: Creating and seeding accounts for every newborn is found to have an impact on aspirations as well as savings.
articles.abstract: Creating and seeding accounts for every newborn is found to have an impact on aspirations as well as savings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Braylon Dedmon was 3 days old when his mother, Talasheia, was offered $1,000 to open a college savings account in his name.

articles.headline: Extremists Find a Financial Lifeline on Twitch
articles.snippet: QAnon adherents and other far-right influencers are making thousands of dollars broadcasting election and vaccine conspiracy theories on the streaming site.
articles.abstract: QAnon adherents and other far-right influencers are making thousands of dollars broadcasting election and vaccine conspiracy theories on the streaming site.
articles.lead_paragraph: Terpsichore Maras-Lindeman, a podcaster who fought to overturn the 2020 presidential election, recently railed against mask mandates to her 4,000 fans in a live broadcast and encouraged them to enter stores maskless. On another day, she grew emotional while thanking them for sending her $84,000.
